text: Fun hipster environment, and is BYOB so you can't go wrong with that. Pretty small restaurant seating about 20 tables. Really nice waitress and chef (met him to speak about the amazing sauce on the Amish Chicken dish). We ordered the tempura catfish special and Amish chicken. The catfish was really tasty, and came with tempura fries that were good as well. The Amish chicken had an amazing red chili/honey sauce on it that was full of umami flavor.  Would highly recommend based on food, service, and BYOB.

Bite is one of my favorite brunch spots.  They have high quality vegetarian cuisine here.  Everything I have had here has been sooo delicious except for their Chilaquiles.  Our go to here for brunch is their Veggie Eggs Benedict and Veggie Breakfast Poutine.  The eggs benedict can be made without the meat and it comes with a generous portion of spinach underneath the poached egg.  The hollandaise sauce and pimento cheddar spread are heavenly!  I am not crazy about pimento cheddar but this place makes me like it.  Their mashbrown is also great and a nice spin on the traditional hashbrown, breakfast potatoes concept.  Their vegetarian poutine is out of this world!  I love their mushroom gravy.  It's soooo hard to find vegetarian gravy for poutine because they are usually beef or chicken (how lame), but Bite offers a truly scrumptious mushroom gravy for their poutine.  Their fries are a great balance between crunchy and soft, the gravy and cheese curds are well distributed along with the fried eggs on top making for an oozing liquid deliciousness once you pop that egg yolk. The pickled chilis are good but I think they could have giardiniera or banana peppers instead of the pickled chilis.   I also came here for dinner once and loved their vegetarian burger.  It was not that generic frozen stuff you get, it was fresh and made right there with tasty aioli and generous serving of fries. It's also BYOB, which makes it even more appealing of a place to eat at.  The prices are reasonable, especially for the quality of food you're getting.  Then the BYOB aspect makes it even more affordable to come here.  Service is usually fine.  I just wish this place was bigger and had a patio.
Good breakfast, nice service and convenient location for us. It's been here for years but I can't believe my first trip was recent.

A handful of vegan options that make it a good place for veg/meat eaters to dine together, which is very appreciated. The vegan dishes leave a little to be desired though, and might be a bit on the bland side compared to other spots in Chicago. Nice atmosphere, awesome staff, and the portion to price ratio is on point.

You wouldn't necessarily expect for a quality restaurant to be situated on this relatively colorless stretch of Western, but it would be unfortunate if you missed the opportunity to sample the food here. Bite Cafe has a casual-cool vibe which makes it seem like it DGAF, but a glance at the menu items shows that an abundance of Fs are G. The dishes have obviously been conceived with a lot of care. Breakfast was the meal that brought me here. I started off with their great coffee, sourced from Dark Matter, a blocks south on Western. I opted for their acclaimed Pork Hash. The poached eggs and spiced hollandaise added a richness to the underlying hash, which featured very flavorful pork shoulder, chunks of tender potatoes, and enough vegetables so you don't feel too guilty eating it. It was the best breakfast I've had in months. Why only four stars? Service was somewhat inattentive, never checking on the table after the food arrived, and only offering a coffee refill after it was obvious that I was done eating. I hope that was an anomaly, because the food here was truly excellent.
Great staff and great food. Loved the small/home style kitchen vibe. Their coffee was fantastic too.

Can I give Bite Café 10 stars? Yes? How about 100? I think I just found my new go-to breakfast/brunch spot. Let's start with the coffee. With my absolute favorite coffee, Dark Matter, I knew right away that this place couldn't possibly disappoint. I was right, this is brunch heaven. The one thing that bothers me more than anything about restaurants is how sterile many of them they try to make the food to the point where theres no balance, complexity, or personality in the food. I was so glad to find that Bite Café's dishes were all  pretty rustic without sacrificing the quality or presentation. This is what i'm truly all about. Started with the biscuit with jam and butter. This biscuit had a wonderful golden crust on the outside that leads the way in to a warm, flakey, buttery inside that's absolutely arousing. The housemade jam it comes with is so delicious and paired with the butter makes for the best sweet and salty combo. You won't regret it. We ordered the pulled pork scrambler and the french toast. Boy were these plates big! I don't usually get scramblers, but based on recommendations here I decided to give it a try. Boy am I glad that I did. Somehow they've given a new meaning to a scrambler for me. All the veggies were perfectly tender and not overcooked while the pulled pork covered in the hollandaise and poached egg yolk complimented it perfectly. It was heaven. Maybe could have done without as much hollandaise sauce just cause thats my own personal preference, but they certainly give you enough food and bread to soak it all up! The french toast was also wonderful! The rich goat cheese faired well against the sweet elements of the french toast without one overpowering the other. Although it was maybe a little soggier and I wished they used thicker bread, this certainly didn't pull away from the overall experience. All in all, a marvelous experience and my new brunch spot. Friendly staff, comfortable space (but pretty limited seating), easy free parking, easy commute from the south side while avoiding major areas like Wicker Park. Don't know what else I can ask for! I'll definitely be back more! Absolutely amazing.
Unique food, great atmosphere, BYOB. Consistently great food and service -- one of my go-to spots in Chicago.

Thank you Bite Cafe for being open early on a day that I was starving after class! Hooray! I stumbled upon Bite Cafe merely from a simple Yelp search that was open during the time.  I really enjoyed the interior of this restaurant from the simple seating, open space, and the paintings on the walls. I'm not sure if they tend to change the paintings on the wall, but I really liked the fruit paintings (which I DID INDEED mistake as photographs. Got me there.) Off the menu, there was a few things I really wanted to try. Ultimately, I went with the breakfast poutine. Why? I miss eating poutine in Canada and how can anyone really say no to fries and cheese curds? I enjoyed my food, but not enough that I would want to eat it again. I was kind of sad by the baby cheese curds. It was like minced sizes. I am looking for chucks that is oozy. I did not get it here. I still enjoyed my meal though. I would love to come back and try other things off their menu.

Went here for breakfast after moving into the area.  Great little spot, got there early and wer the second party in and about 30 min later, it really started to fill up.  Menu's pretty good with different things to try for breakfast.  Their coffee is AMAZING and I'm not even a coffee connoisseur.  I got the spring veggie hash which was decent, but wish they used diff veggies, the ones they chose had no flavor whatsoever and only thing that was flavorful was the tofu, everything else in there was bland. Can't remember what the b/f got, but I also did order a side of biscuit and jam.  The biscuit had good flavor but was a bit dry and not sure if it was supposed to be that way, but the jam they served it with was good.  All in all, decent place, but will try others before coming back here, but seriously...the coffee.

The food is great but the service gave me so much attitude it was unbelievable. I sat in the empty bottle side and the first thing they tell me is I'm not allowed to move a chair so I could sit by my friends who were already there. It's a huge place, so it's not like it would block anyone's path. Also I was getting ready to order a full ass brunch, I would be spending the $$$ to warrant me sitting in the chair. Once we placed our orders, mine didn't come out for 30 minutes. When I asked for them to check on it, they kept insisting it would be out soon. Finally, after saying for the 3rd time it was on its way I canceled the order, everyone else had finished their meal 20 minutes prior. The bartender/ waitress gives me pushback saying "Well if you want to cancel it, I guess you can but it will fuck up the kitchen"  Really?? You fucked up my morning by making me wait for 1.5 hours to eat, then stringing me along saying it would be out soon.

I've only been here once for brunch and really enjoyed it! The vegan and vegetarian options are plentiful. The front windows bring in a ton of light and the general vibe is light and fresh. A great spot for fresh ingredients and Whole Foods
Its a 4 star place, nothing overly fancy, just good food executed well. Great specials, green river pop, everything you want in a neighborhood go to spot. I go once a month, never disappointed.
Breakfast, lunch or dinner, Bite offers excellent food and great service. BYOB is awesome. Great for smaller groups or a date.  They basically just do everything right here.

The food is underwhelming. I ordered the poke bowl and my boyfriend ordered the gnocchi with oxtail - it wasn't flavorful at all. It lacked salt and some acid.  The babaganush was delicious - so definitely order that as an appetizer, as well as the beet salad!

Good service. My boyfriend got the French toast they were good nothing out of the ordinary and I got their mushroom breakfast poutine and it was good, but the poached eggs and gravy was not a god mixture. The coffee is a bit too strong.
Had a really nice BYOB dinner here with a professor and friends.

Can't say enough good things about this place. We went on a Sunday morning around 11am and got seated right away. When we left, there was definitely a wait.  Even though there were a few "quality" issues with our food, our concerns were addressed quickly and handled so graciously by the staff. We'll definitely be back!

I have been going here since I was kid and absolutely love it. The restaurant is quaint with great art on the walls. It's BYOB and also connected to the empty bottle. I love their vegetarian and vegan options like the vegan pozole and the veggie burger. The chocolate cream tart with season fruit and a homemade crust is beyond delicious. Super reasonable prices and get service.
cockroaches on wall and service was bad despite the restaraunt being totally dead :( wanted to like this place
The best neighborhood restaurant for a wonderful dinner or quick bite. Lived around the corner for 12 years and it is still a constant!

The star rating above is for Bite Cafe. The overall review is of the chicken sandwich from Leghorn that I ultimately ate after being completely ignored by service staff for nearly 20 minutes after being seated at Bite Cafe: My pickle-brined chicken sandwich on a biscuit was delicious.

My fiancé and I live a couple of blocks from Bite. We have never disliked anything we have ordered. We love the mussels. So delicious and spicy. Make sure to dip bread in the juice. The salads are all great. Super fresh, my fave is the gem lettuce with fresh crisp veggies. Every special is the bomb. Risotto of any kind you can't go wrong. Braised short rib.... no words. Gnocchi and oxtail- fire. IT'S ALL DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!

Amazing! One of the best dinners I've had in a long time. The calamari was one of the most tender I've ever enjoyed. I had the trout special and it was cooked to perfection. My friend had the gnocchi and it was so fluffy and delicious. I would've had food envy if my own wasn't so damn good! And it's byob! I will be back and bringing friends!

Was excited to try after seeing all the 4-5 star reviews.  Was very underwhelmed - Challah Biscuits and gravy was a 5/10, chorizo had far too much clove in it 1/10, pork hash was decent 5/10, french toast was good (but when is it not?) 6/10 service was fine--  overall, there are too many other breakfast places to try in this area...  i appreciate the service, but we wont be back.

Right next to the empty bottle! BYOB and food was great! I like small and you may have a wait.  I have to say the food was wonderful. I was cautious and had a grilled cheese and tomatoe soup. Tomato Fennel soup and Sourdough grilled cheese! Crispy sandwich not soggy! The Burger my friend had was a great size -he said it was really satisfying and great fries. We split a challahbread dessert which was SO GOOD!!! Fyi, if you go in evening -you can grab a drink from empty bottle and they offer some good choices of beer on tap.

Love, love, love brunch here. Laid-back spot yet attentive service and delicious food. More modern/hip fare than your average diner. Last time I had the pork shoulder hash with brussels sprouts, kale, sweet potatoes, and hollandaise. It was divine. Fresh breads like pear-brown sugar or strawberry, also very good.

Came here for brunch last Sunday around 10:30 am. They were only half full at the time but come 11 every single seat was taken. The cafe is right next to the Empty Bottle on Western; it's very small and very hipster. They had some special Dark Matter coffee on their menu so my coffee aficionado friend was pretty pumped about that. My eyes, on the other hand, quickly located the breakfast poutine on the menu. Fries, gravy, cheese curds, poached eggs, oh yeah. Perfect hangover cure for sure. I also ordered a breakfast taco which was delicious. Huge taco stuffed with egg, veggies and guac on the side for only $3! Best dish on our table was probably my other friend's pork hash. That tasted amazing! Would probably get that next time. Good spot for brunch! Would come back if I was in the area.

Brunch here is fantastic! The portions are huge and service was quick. Came in on a Saturday around 11 and no wait. By the time we were leaving all the tables were full, so would come on an off time if you're with a big group since there are no resos. We tried the pork hash and egg benedict. I also got the hot tea, which came in a cute little pot with tea leaves. I usually don't like earl grey, but it was really strong which was just what I needed.  Will definitely be back to try this place for dinner, especially with it being BYOB!

Great food! The place is kind of small so very hard to get seating but if you are willing to wait the place is hard to be! Place feels very contemporary modern hipster. Had the burger with egg and just the way they seasoned the burger was great.

The eggs benedict was okay. Nothing spectacular, the sriracha hollandaise was bland. The mash brown was actually pretty good. Coffee was good. Service was okay. But, the bathroom is literally smack dab in the middle of the kitchen. Like, on my way out of the bathroom, I had to open the door slowly and say excuse me because a cook was stirring a pot of sauce or something literally with his back against the door. Something tells me that this is not sanitary at all. There are just simply too many brunch spots in Chicago to settle for just 'okay' food. If I lived next door, maybe. But coming across the city, nah.

Absolutely welcoming and attentive staff. Cozy diner style kinda place, with wicker lamps, tile tables, and quilted art pieces. Fairly small menu, but what they make, they surely deliver. They also have a great specials menu that changes frequently. Food is served within 5-7 minutes-exceptional fast. Most plates have a well balanced visual and health appeal; salad, toast, and eggs mixed with your choice of protein and veggies. I come here frequently!

While I have had many menu items and they are always great, last night's order delivered through the Caviar app was OUTSTANDING. The vegan posole is the best darn vegan thing I've eaten in ages. I know "vegan" and "posole" are not words typically put in the same sentence. It was SOOOO flavorful and satisfying! My meat-eater hubby had the shortrib gnocchi, which he stated was also out-of-this-world. My husband lived in Italy with an Italian family of cooks for several years. He is VERY judgmental about his gnocchi. I have never seen him eat a gnocchi that was up to his standards in the 10 years I've known him, actually. He said that this gnocchi was literally PERFECT. Way to go, Bite. Way to go!!!
Place is great.  Staff is A+.  Menu is eclectic, affordable and always changing.  BYOB.  Brunch rules too.

The food here is great and I love the overall vibe! I live very close and have been here probably a dozen times, however, every time I go the service is terrible. That's why I am giving three stars. I mean they are like down right rude. Excluding a few glimmering and smiling faces, nearly every time I go to this place I am met with attitude. It's really OK because the price is right, and the food tastes delicious, and I really like the inside of the restaurant. But dang, these folks need an attitude adjustment. I would totally recommend, but just beware :)

i'm pretty shocked this place has good reviews... seriously, am sincerely shocked. i ate here once and i'll never eat here again. their food is sub par, at most. their service is really what did it in for me. i took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner. he picked it out, i took him. the menu was promising, but under delivered. my burger? first, they got the order wrong - didn't even offer to fix it - second, i asked for medium and got extremely well done. my boyfriend got the chicken and waffles which were pretty good, but the overall presentation, collard greens, and lack of ration made it kind of suck.  what really bothered me was the service. alright - totally understand it's a small place. i've ate in a place that literally has one person doing everything - including cooking - but she was attentive. our waitress was too busy leaning over the counter and chatting with a dude. one he left, she was more attentive. seriously, don't care that you wanna get it - but please don't take 10 minutes to even acknowledge us and bring water. i feel like i was legitimately staring at you, and you could definitely see me. of note, i did see another women, who i don't even know if she works there, chatting in back with three of the cooks, and eating fries from where food is prepared? talk about sanitation issues. that made me completely uncomfortable.  the waitress didn't explain any of the menu. i happened to know it was chicken and waffle night and had to ask her IF it was available. she said "oh yeah, of course." overall, don't go here on a wednesday night unless you're one of two couples in a restaurant and want bad service.

Really great food! First time I went I got the Benedict and even though it had no meat it was sooo filling! The flavors were extravagant The next time I went, I ordered the fries. I'm not usually a fry person, especially for breakfast- but it has such yummy eggs on top! I was so full. Great place(:

One of my favorite restaurants while I was in Chicago! (though I think almost all of the restaurants I eat at in Chicago qualify...)  Do yourself a favor and get the pastrami sandwich.  Fantastic pastrami with a fried egg on top to temper the saltiness.  Absolutely perfect.  I'm not normally a huge breakfast person (or sandwich person), but this absolutely won me over.  Also, top notch fries.  I would certainly love to come and eat here again!

I've been to this place a number of times and really enjoyed my meals, but took my dad there yesterday and was completely disappointed. Our salads were good, but I sent back the pho I ordered. It was inedible, truthfully the most bland thing I've ever had. Tasted like they cooked some plain tofu and steamed some vegetables and just threw those in a flavorless broth. My dad ordered the risotto and said it was completely bland as well. Not sure if they were just having an off night or what, but I'm definitely not in a rush to go back. The waitress took the pho off the bill immediately, but she didn't come over to check on us until we had long finished eating, so it was too late by that point when she asked if I wanted something else. No offer of dessert either, she just came by and dropped the check.
I love this place. Great food. Super nice servers. Really fast service. I've never had a bad experience here.

I love Bite Cafe. I've been there many times but my most recent experience there has left a very sour taste in my mouth.  I have a non-life threatening but very uncomfortable nut allergy. Bite cafe does not list all ingredients for their dishes on the menu. This has happened to me three times in the past at Bite where a dessert or entree does not have nuts listed on the menu, but the dish is covered in nuts, I eat it, and have an allergic reaction. Yes, since I am the person with the allergy, I should inform my waiter or waitress of this allergy up front. To be fair, I didn't do that, but I did ask the waitress if I could speak to the manager/chef etc.  She blew me off at first and tried to tell me that it's my fault because I didn't let her know about my allergy. I said, "I understand, but I would still like to talk to the manager." Before I finished my sentence, she stomped away to go get him, and didn't come back to speak with me. The manager, chef, or whoever he was, came over and I explained the situation, and that this has happened multiple times in the past. I asked him to list all ingredients on the menu. I wasn't angry or rude. I was simply trying to prevent another situation like this from happening to someone else. He said, "sure, ok, I apologize," and walked away.  I wasn't fishing for a discount or free meal, but I feel the staff at Bite really blew me off in this situation. I feel like they're just a bunch of hipsters who really didn't care either way about my experience. No one was friendly or understanding. They didn't care about what I was saying.  So yeah, overall, the food is good, but I don't think I'll be going back to Bite.

It was a rare (and freezing) Tuesday date night. We were going to Empty Bottle next door for a benefit concert, and decided to grab a quick meal beforehand.  We decided to go relatively light with the food considering it was kinda late (around 8:30), I had just worked out, and my date ate a snack earlier to tide him over.  We didn't realize it was BYOB, ooops, but fear not! You can run next door (and thankfully stay inside) to the Empty Bottle and ask for a beer that you can walk back to your table, and we did just that.  For food, we shared the Beet Salad and 3 tofu tacos. The food was great! The salad tasted extremely fresh and had a beautiful presentation, and the tofu tacos were surprisingly very filling (yes for black beans!). We even had a hard time finishing the 3 tacos. But everything tasted excellent.  Service was cool. The interior is quaint and homey. It's pretty small so I can see how it can fill up real fast.  After dinner we just walked straight into the Empty Bottle and enjoyed the show! Bite Cafe is definitely worth checking out.

Each time I go here I try something new. I recommend the breakfast tacos or the oxtail gnocchi. Both have nice flavors to them and ingredients are fresh. I don't recall what my family or friends had when we've ate there however they enjoyed their food.

Trying to check off Bite from Thrillist's "most hipster restaurants in Chicago" list.  OK we're really not doing that, but living in Logan Square we have been to most of them already and happened to be in ukee village and hungry on a Saturday afternoon.  Tiny place adjacent to uber dive bar The Empty Bottle and doesn't take reservations.  Luckily said dive bar was open so my partner and I were able to belly up to the bar for and Old Style and coffee while we waited for our table.  We were summoned on about half an hour.  Service was prompt, friendly and noninvasive and the food was delivered fairly rapidly considering how busy it was.  I ordered the pork hash while kale and sweet potatoes.  The pork was well seasoned and the veggies were tender without being mushy.  The poached eggs were slightly overdone for most people's taste I imagine, but I appreciated the fact that yolk wasn't running all over the rest of the bowl, though a slice of flavorful sourdough is included.  My better half ordered pork and black bean chilli and biscuits and gravy.  The chilli was rich and meaty but the gravy seemed a little bland and the biscuits a tad dry.  Props to bite for having Crystal hot sauce on the table over Frank's or Sriracha.  Overall a good brunch and I'm sure we will return, only next time we will remember to bring a bottle of champagne for mimosas.
too small a table for 5 people and my medium burger came absolutely rare. Gonna have the trots later. Pork hash was fantastic though

Finally found a place serving brunch that doesn't knock you out after. I got the wild rice bibimbop and split an order of the coconut bread (daily special). The coconut bread came out similar to banana bread--slightly sweet and rather dense. I found it a bit dry, but the abundance of coconut flakes totally made up for it.  Also completely in love with the bibimbop here. It's hard to find restaurants that serve vegetables well outside of salads, but the vegetables were definitely the star of the bibimbop here. I also loved how they chose to use wild rice instead of white rice--it's healthier and left me feeling much better about myself after the meal.  Overall, a super low-key brunch place that serves delicious, healthy options as well as more typical brunch items.

We were staying in the area for the weekend and this breakfast place was so nice, we ate there twice.  The Dark Matter coffee is strong and flavorful, and loose leaf tea is brewed in a little pot and brought to the table. The pimento cheese eggs Benedict is easily the best breakfast dish I have had in recent memory. I also tried the Migas, solid but not as flavorful as the Benny. We also enjoyed the mashbrown. Both times we went we arrived between 10 & 10:30 and were seated immediately.

Bite isn't underrated, but it's under-appreciated. I prefer Bite over most other brunch spots, including Longman & Eagle. Dishes are thoughtful and flavorful (Pork Hash, Pastrami -- so good, Poutine, burger). Really I think you can choose anything on the menu and leave feeling pretty good about your decisions. Come to Bite to feel good about your decision-making skills. BUT, the last time I was at Bite, I ordered the Pork Hash and some of the potatoes weren't cooked for long enough, leaving an unintended crunch. One cube was literally uncooked. It was probably a mistake in the kitchen, OR it was the chef's artful commentary on how every now and then, the simplest of things that we do not think about daily, when done poorly can alter an experience. Either way, I wish it was cooked properly.

I was there last night with friends and it was the worst experience at a restaurant. We dropped 50.00 each, ate our meal like people do when they are out with friends and we were still chatting, winding down when we were asked to give up our table. We were not there that long and there were open tables, not at all crowded and the whole night was delightful even though our original waitress acted like she didn't want to be there. 65 years in chicago and never once no matter where I ate, high end or the corner diner, did this ever happen. Two of the dishes were very good, Calamari and the Beef Rib tip. The fish fry was polock, nothing special, and the hamburger ordinary. We had a challah bread pudding. It was just french toast, very sweet, okay. Before we were asked, I went to the restroom through the kitchen. Messy. But I walked by a huge plate of ingredients, I think peppers or tomatoes and thought I hope the customers were not sneezing in this. My advice is to add a little class to your menu!

The food was delicious but spoiled by the service who kicked us out even though there were plenty of tables. My advice is don't pay your bill right away if you want to linger over your byob. I will not return in spite of the good food. This is Chicago where delicious food abounds and people appreciate your patronage.

When you can enjoy a solid brunch that shares a wall (and restrooms) with one of the best music venues in America (the Empty Bottle), it's hard to go wrong.  Bite Cafe is the bright yin to Empty Bottle's dark yang, and it's usually a perfect option for a weekend brunch with a small group of friends. With lots of familiar brunch foods you've seen on other brunch menus alongside a few signature wrinkles you'll only find at Bite, you'd be hard pressed to find something you won't enjoy. Get the breakfast poutine if you're feeling like throwing caution to the wind, or enjoy a hangover salad if you're a reasonably responsible adult. But regardless of which route you take, please make sure you order a side of mashbrowns. It's a game changer. The service can be hit or miss, but hopefully you're eating there during a hit. Because the misses can be so unpleasant, it might ruin your experience.

so disappointed.... the food is okay at best. even the her bed biscuit is nothing too special, a bit dry. coffee is water mud but what I dislike the most....the service. all the staff there look hung over, and have a chip on their shoulders about answering any questions.  I asked for ketchup and got nothing. we asked for a top off of coffee and she gave us a look.

This restaurant is adorable! The food was super delicious and the service was great. I had the grilled cheese and tomato fennel soup. My boyfriend had the short rib. Both were fantastic. The next time I come, I'm definitely going to try the salted caramel brownie! Also, this place is BYO. I highly recommend!

Honestly, I expected a fulfilling meal from Bites Cafe, being that the establishment had a thorough reputation from friends and family. Unfortunately, my girlfriend was quite disappointed when arriving and realizing there was no more bacon for our brunch meal. Unlike many, we both pride ourselves on the necessity of a hearty first meal of the day, which provides the prerequisite nutrition and heartfelt experience necessary for a successful day. Yes, eggs themselves offer hearty unsaturated fat and bioavailable protein needed; yet no brunch pallet is complete without the crisp completeness of bacon's beauty.... We both look forward to continuing our journey in brunching, yet I cannot promise this will be a pit stop worth returning to...
Shared the broccoli risotto and the rainbow trout.   Risotto was under-cooked, rainbow trout over-salted.  Overall overpriced experience for unsatisfying food.
The food was good, but the drip coffee was noticeably bad! For a cafe, I expected better.

My mom and I came here for a late lunch after moving day for me. It had already been a long day and we both just needed something to eat to keep us going.  We both ended up with the Grilled cheese & tomato soup and we couldn't have been happier.  We enjoyed the tomato bisque and the grilled cheese was excellent.  Exactly the sustenance we needed to fuel the rest of the day.   Service was friendly but unobtrusive.  I hope to make it in for dinner soon.

This was a random find close to our new home!! it has been quite the fun feat to find exciting new places around and yelp is a place we use and trust! When we wanted a new breakfast/brunch spot, we consulted yelp and found Bite Cafe!!! We came around 9:30 on Labor Day and it was starting to get crowded, but we sat immediately.  By the time we left there were many groups outside waiting to be seated.  The entire menu looks amazing, but I went with the veggie burger and my husband the housemade pastrami.  The veggie burger was great, but not completely mind blowing, would totally get again though, that could be because my husbands pastrami WAS mind blowing!!!!  It was so delish!!!  The pastrami was extremely smokey, the horsey sauce spicy and the egg completmented it amazing!!!  We can't wait to come back and try some new yummy stuff!!!

I had my first dinner experience at Bite last night and I was almost happier walking out than I was after my brunch  here (NOTE: I'm more of a dinner person).  I had the special, which was fried tofu in a curry base - yes, there were parts that were a little bland I admit, but nothing some salt couldn't spice up. Overall, Bite is diner-friendly in that you rarely have to wait, you can bring your own booze without a corkage fee, you can slip in and duck out in a reasonable time frame, it's pretty straight and to the point, there's an array of menu items for both the meat-ies and the vegg-ies.

I brought my girlfriend here on an improvised brunch date on our visit to Chicago. We ordered coffees and breakfast food. Included in my order was the best hash brown I have ever had the privilege of eating. I do not traditionally write reviews. However, this hash brown was outstanding! In addition, the service was great and so was the atmosphere.

Bite is so quirky and sweet. I love this place! Took off one star because of the uncomfortable seating and it felt like there wasn't any air inside. Other than that, I will be back and definitely recommend!

Adorable, cozy, and most importantly delicious:  A decent amount of seating for a such a small place. A little cramped but it's ok. There are about 5-6 stool seats at the brunch bar up front.  Specials are on the chalkboard up high in the back. They bake interesting bread too. I had apple/carrot. Huge slice. I would share one. I also had the pastrami sandwich which was insane. Toasted bread, cheese, red onion, pastrami, and egg. Couldn't even finish it but damn it was good.  Friend had bacon gravy and biscuits and it looked good. But didn't try. Everyone left happy.  And that's all I have to say about that.  Jackée

Would definitely flash my chest for a damn good savory sauce and Bite knows what's up! After a nearly 25-year hiatus from eating red meat, I knew exactly where to go test me chops again. And if you're not into chops, the selections from the sea are for the snatchin' tambien. If that don't work, there's plenty from garden. We've lost so many wonderful BYOB spots in Chicago and thank GAWDDuhh that Bite is still around, firing on all burners. Bite is definitely a Chicago's BYOB elder statesmyn as they've been around a very long time. (Who remembers the tiny primer school, hardcover menu books they used to have about 10 years ago? :) Stick around and check out one of the last old school Chitown bars as Empty Bottle is right next door. Have seen MANY amazing live shows here, especially on Mondays. Love you Bite. Truly dewww.

Great breakfast menu and dinner menu. Very reasonable prices for great quality ingredients. They use fantastic dark matter coffee. The mashbrown is on the forefront of the breakfast potato movement. The bacon and sausage are well worth it. For the dinner the burger is also great.

Delicious food. Fresh, creative, tasty. Have eaten here a few tines and its always good. I like the vegetarian options. The seasonal salad is probably the best salad in Chicago. Grilled wedges of romaine, fresh peas, just YUM. We loved the gnocchi... Kichen had NO issue creating this sans meat and creating a vegetarian sauce. We will be back for more!

Hipster-style cafe with great food, great service, and a relaxed quirky vibe. I had the veggie burger which was house-made and delish, my husband had the beef short ribs which he really liked. We split the asparagus appetizer which was fried in a tempura batter. Overall this place is affordable with great food. Definitely recommend!

4 stars for food 1 star for service This place is small and can feel uncomfortably warm on a humid day as this past Friday was but overall the ambience is nice and it's a plus that it's BYOB. I ordered the Pan Roasted Whitefish and my boyfriend got the Beef Short Rib Au Poivre. Both dishes were good but we both agreed the portions weren't generous. My dish especially was small and unsatisfying (it's basically a tiny fillet with peas and bacon bits). I've been here twice and both times the staff is awful. Our waitress (may have been the same as last time) was rude and she clearly doesn't understand the meaning of being in the service industry. In addition to her sarcastic stares and pretentious responses to our questions about the menu, one of her major offenses was bringing us the check right away without asking if we would like anything else or wanted to see the dessert menu (I know they have one because she had just offered it to the table next to us). This place would be so much better if they staffed nice tattooed chicks instead of these a**hole ones.

Food was delicious! I came here with a few friends and we all loved the vibe and the food. I ordered the Hangover Salad which is similar to a Lyonaise salad only has a fantastic blend of sweet and savory- not something I expected, but so good. I also got the herbed biscuit with homemade jam and butter - amazing. I am so excited to have found this place and that I live blocks away. Coming back soon.

Good food terrible customer service . Just walked in .... 3 tables empty . Told we have to wait because there are two of us and they are hoping tables of 4 walk in ....... No one else is in line waiting for a table ... So yes that makes sense let's wait outside in the heat while you hope other customers come in.

Bite Cafe is a cute spot in Ukrainian Village that serves three meals a day, but it's the brunch that I mostly care about. I've been here twice: once for dinner and once for brunch. I got a couple of beef brisket tacos for dinner the first time I came here. The flavors were good but the brisket was way too oily to the point where the tortillas had been saturated with oil by the time it was served to me so I had to eat the tacos with a fork and knife. I was hesitant to go back but decided to try it again for brunch. I walked in with two other people on a Saturday at noon, and the hostess said that the wait would be about 30-45 minutes. The actual wait ended up being about an hour and 20 minutes, but we had gotten coffees at the nearby Empty Bottle, so we weren't quite as grumpy. There were some interesting selections from the menu, but I ended up getting my usual: Eggs Benedict. The portion was huge, and the eggs were cooked perfectly. We also got some biscuits and jam to share, which were equally delicious. The best part was how cheap everything was given the quality of the food. If you come here for brunch, try calling ahead to get a time estimate but don't be surprised if the wait is much longer. It's worth it though!

Bite is my favorite restaurant in Chicago because it's so reliably good! I've been coming here for over two decades and through different owners. It keeps getting better and better. The staff greets us like old friends. The specials are always unique and fresh. My favorite standbys are consistently delicious. I've never waited long for a table and love eating at the counter if crowded. High end foodie experience balanced perfectly with casual laid back atmosphere and reasonable prices. Great vegetarian options always.  Tip your waitresses well! They deserve it and so does the chef staff!

Just went the other day and gotta say, I will definitely be back.  I was hoping to get the Skate Wing(saw it on the menu online) but they change things up and didn't have it when I came in.  Oh well, guess I'll have to come back. For starters, the place is comfortable and pretty busy, usually a good sign.  The servers were really friendly and helpful.  I love to ask for recommendations so this is always helpful. As for the food, everything we tried was really good and reasonably priced.  We will definitely be back.

Stumbled upon this restaurant a few months back, and a blessing it sure was! I had forgotten to write a review, but better late than never. Absolutely amazing food, and also very good prices. Must admit it was my favorite restaurant in Chicago! Try the ox tail entree - it's mouth watering!
Very yummy food!! Love all of the food options and BYOB is definitely a plus! Cozy and hip place; friendly staff! My boyfriend and I had an amazing experience and will definitely return here! :)

Love love love the food here. It does get busy on weekends but if you avoid the rush times you shouldn't have trouble getting in. They do not take reservations. There's always good options on the rotating daily specials chalkboard but I am a huge fan as well of the tried-and-true regulars on the menu like the burger, salads, and tacos.
I love bite cafe and I love that it is BYOB even more. I have had the pork hash and eggs Benedict before and they were both super good.

Hipster neighborhood bar / brunch spot in Ukrainian Village - pretty cool, giant space with pool/arcade room, large back bar and cozy brunch room with counter bar. Pork hash was easily one of the best stick-to-your-ribs brunch dishes I've ever had - sweet, satisfying food coma, not the regret-filled kind. Braised pork shoulder, sunchoke, sweet potatoes, kale, Yukon potatoes, onion, eggs, spicy Hollandaise with a grilled sourdough - just do it. Be prepared for a wait on weekends, grab a drink at the back bar while you wait (cash-only). For someone who nonstop craves red meat, tofu scramble looked actually incredibly tempting Smoked whitefish salad and breakfast poutine on the next visit!

It's about time that I reviewed this excellent restaurant. Bite really manages to keep a warm and casual vibe while still serving upscale food. I don't know how they keep their prices so affordable but it's a great place to stop in for lunch, breakfast or dinner - how many restaurants can say that? get the hangover salad with an extra egg. Peep my photo.

I love the place. Its really cute and the first time l went there l was very satisfied having had a pulled pork breakfast dish. Was fantastic. However the second time l went there the hostess came up with some line about "reservations" it was a Saturday morning and a 2 top was available, l basically called her on it but l was with my Bf and he doesnt like to make a big deal out of stupid silly seating power trips,  so we waited until the hostess realize she look stupid (since she did not had a party of 5 coming in  and the people sitting next to the empty 2 top were just not going to go anywhere) and sat us. I mean, there was nobody else waiting. Right there and there, it  ruin pretty much Saturday brunch at this location. Its like going to someone's house and getting snub as soon as you walked in. I know she is just a hourly employee, but your job is to "Be a host!" Not the principal of lane tech high school... right? On to the next visit, l took my GF there for a midweek lunch and had the same dish as last time. Carrots were raw, pork was dry and chewy and l order a shake which tasted it like it was sour or spoiled cream. I honestly took a sip and left at the table.  The waitress came up to me as we were leaving to remind me to take my brand new shake. (I was too embarrased to tell her it was aweful) perhaps is the recipe but it was literally UNdrinkable, what a shame as it was super creamy and had a nice thickness to it. Perhaps they were having Cooler problems? The waitress did mention they make their ice cream in house. Maybe they shouldnt... leave it to Overweiss to do what they do best.  I mean l still have that sour taste in my mouth.  I would like to come back but l wanted to be the day everything is fresh during the week where there is no Nightclub bouncer attitute for a Saturday Morning breakfast 2 blocks away from my house.  (Waitress service has been great every time though) And again, lovely place but the owner probably was out on vacation. Thats my take.  Sight... 3 times l've been there with 3 different people,  Its getting hard to convince them to go there...

I don't understand the hype for this place. The food was okay. Service was bad. My friend received her coke near the end of her meal after reminding the waitress, the waitress didn't apologize for forgetting. I ordered the challah French toast with a mashbrown. The French toast was nothing special. The mashbrown was good but a bit too salty, and definitely overpriced. My friend's bloody Mary from the bar next door was to notch though.  All in all, if you're looking for a cool hip brunch spot, look elsewhere.

Go here. The food is absolutely delicious. We had the Bulgogi beef short ribs with scallion and sticky rice, the Hangover salad and the butternut  squash with cumin, sunflower seeds and brown sugar. Can't beat having milkshakes either. Would go back in a heartbeat.

BYOB, Great food, and great service. Can't really ask for much else. The poutine appetizers was delicious. I had the grilled cheese/ fennel tomato soup. I usually don't like ordering "simple" dishes when I go out to eat, but this was absolutely amazing!! My boyfriend had the short ribs and loved them. The desert was incredible... we had the Belgium Waffle with ice cream.

Pleasantly surprised by the food in this unassuming restaurant attached to the Empty Bottle.  The Pork Hash was delicious, and the Pastrami sandwich was smoky and flavorful.  Perfect portion size, and I really like Dark Matter coffee.  I don't normally revue places out of laziness, but I had to hop on and give it 5 stars.  This place is definitely now in my regular brunch rotation.
Had the overly hyped pork hash. The potatoes were not fully cooked, and were rather hard.

We are new to the area and wanted to check out places that were walking distance from our house. This place is so cute and the food is really good taste wise. Took off a star because my Benedict was cold :( but because it tasted amazing I didn't say anything to a very waitress. Will definitely keep coming here.
Decent breakfast...decent coffee too. Not sure what's changed- or what needs to change but this spot just bores me now. Time for a breakfast menu update!

My friends and I were looking for a good BYOB option because....drankz. Bite Cafe fit the bill and I'm glad we had dinner here as the meal was delicious and didn't break the bank.  They have no corkage fee, yet bring out glasses for your vino and open the bottle which is always a lovely touch. I am a weirdo that brought a giant electronic wine opener...and....we didn't need it. I wouldn't call service overly friendly but they took care of business and got the job done professionally.  The food at Bite Cafe is wonderful with the menu changing often based on seasonal ingredients. My friends and I started with a shared appetizer - the Fresh Cheese, onion compote, Petite Salad and toast for $8. We all loved this and gobbled it right down. The cheese was whipped which made for nice and easy slathering onto the toast. Normally I hate onions. With a passion. Like every bit of my being wishes we could decimate all onion buds off this planet. However, I didn't hate it in jam form served with this dish. Small joys in my life. For my main entrée I had the Pan Roasted Whitefish ($14) which sat atop an acorn squash puree, green beans and a pattypan squash succotash. The fish was cooked well and all of the squash elements were much better than expected. Eating this for dinner gave me good health vibes and the dish satisfied me completely. I tried my friends Slow Cooked Beef Short Rib ($15) which was marinated in a bulgoki marinade. Bulgoki is one of my favorite foods in the world so it was interesting for me to have the marinade on another cut of me - I liked it! Like my dish, this had nice seasonal veggie accompaniments. I also had some of my friend's Grilled Cheese & Tomato Fennel Soup ($10) which I loved. I'd die for this! Four types of cheese (Cheddar, Wisconsin Raw Milk, Gruyere, Provolone) melted onto sourdough bread paired perfectly with their version of tomato soup. So many carbs but oh~so~mouthwatering. I would highly recommend Bite Café as a perfect date spot! It's an intimate location with great food at even better prices plus it's BYOB. I would keep groups small here. We were a table of 4 and it was about as big a group as I would be comfortable with in this petite location. They do not take reservations but there seems to be a waiting type area next door with pool tables. My friends said Bite Café's brunch is also great so I'll be back for that, no doubt. Loved this restaurant and see myself coming back often!
The first Wednesday night I went there and got the chicken and waffles special, is my most cherished memory of my adult life.

The food here was amazing, the selections were really good also. I think the ambiance was perfect for a nice laid back evening, and the staff made it even better. They were attentive, funny and all around welcoming. Thank you to Jesy, she was our server, and she made it a great experience.

Great brunch option.  Enjoyed my pimento cheese eggs benedict.  The bi bim bop bowl was very tasty, freshy, and healthy.  Would definitely come back to try other items.  Was no wait on the weekend when coming early.

Awesome place. Very quaint, great and quick service and it's BYOB with no cork fee. I had the Migas, which resembles Chilaquilas but much lighter. It was to die for, I was really impressed with this dish and added a bit of hot sauce to it and it was just what I needed.  Highly recommend this place for a cool hipstery brunch. Will definitely be back to this place...oh and did I mention my bill came out to under $30 for 2 people and we left full.

Yay! 700th review for this place... I haven't been here in years, but last night decided not to cook on short notice and needed a decent BYOB spot open on a Monday night and decided to try out Bite again.  It was pretty busy for early on a Monday night, we had a tostada and the fried artichokes for an appetizer with the pork medallions and the daily risotto with bleu cheese and bacon... everything was well cooked and seasoned nicely, all of our plates went back scraped clean.  Service was spot on, being perfectly on hand, pleasant, and unobtrusive... at one point when I tried to cut the tostada in half to split, we lost the top of it to the floor like idiots and a sharp eyed gentleman from the kitchen appeared a minute later with a new one for us.... that kind of service with the decently priced tasty menu has moved Bite up into my line up to attend more often, sorry I missed so many years.

I have to say. I just didn't love Bite Cafe. I ate there last Thursday night with a friend who raves about it. We decided to share apps and went with the mussels, poutine, and a side of macaroni and cheese. While nothing we ate was bad everything felt like it was missing a little something.  The mussels broth was quite bland. It needed either some salt or a kick to it to make it work. I will say the mussels were quite large but I definitely got a bit of sand in one of mine.  The poutine was fine but it lacked the large cheese curds that I so enjoy in poutine. It was also unexpectedly spicy, I like spice but wasn't in the mood for spicy poutine that night.  Not much to say about the macaroni and cheese. It was good but I've had much better.  Finally, we got the salted chocolate brownie and ice cream for dessert. It was probably the most enjoyable thing we ordered; however, it's not served hot so don't be expecting that. I will say the salt definitely came out in the brownie which o loved. All in all Bite is affordable and has perfectly fine food and a nice ambiance but with so many other choices I won't be back.

The girlfriend and I decided on Bite Cafe for the dinner portion of our dinner-date and were not disappointed. We started with poutine with bacon gravy, which had a bit of a kick to it but was a perfect pair to the fresh cheese curds. Our main course consisted of two amazing meals: a cheeseburger topped with bacon and a fried egg, and gnocchi with oxtail. The burger was extremely juicy, making for one delicious mess. The oxtail was flavorful but the gnocchi melted in my mouth and may have been the best part of the meal if not for the chocolate milkshake we split for dessert. Also my highly recommend trying their milkshakes, especially the chocolate. One of the best chocolate milkshakes we have had, comes with chocolate syrup and whipped cream. Definitely worth going back! Only wish we knew about the BYOB before going!!

I'm originally from Ohio where the best food available comes from a franchise restaurant. In other words, pretty much all food in the Chicago area is amazing to me. Except the burgers at Bite. It was by a long shot the worst burger I've ever had and I survived in college on awful Wal-Mart Flanders patties for 4 years. And their fall salad tastes like death mixed with cheese and fruit. Cheesy, fruity death salad.

I want to update my review to 5 stars on the establishment and food alone. Though the stretch of Western this is on is very dicey. Like just ugly and watch out for needles- not joking. A little skid-row-ish. There is some dilapidated large factory/sanitarium looking building across the street which seems to be a place people shoot up in front of or something because there were hypodermic needles on the ground. Be mindful when wearing flip flops! That would sure put a damper on brunching fun. Anyway back to food. All of the dishes here are super. Not that I've tried them all but I speak confidently in knowing they're great based on the few dishes I've had here myself. Good place, they don't rush you out the door and there are creative and tasty dishes on the menu.  They should relocate to Logan Square or a nicer area where they can have a patio setting and give Longman a run for their money. Just my two cents.

Every time I come to Bite Café, I chide myself for not eating here more often. Though I've only been for brunch, the several times I've had it, have all been great. Luckily all of the brunches have been on random midweek days off so have never had to wait for a table.  On my most recent visit, I dined with my mom. She had the French toast while I ordered a hash special and then we split halfway. Everything was so good and quite filling. Portion sizes are quite large. It's really the perfect place for breakfast on a cold morning as you'll leave full, warm, and ready for a nap.  The restaurant is small and cozy with a friendly staff. I've always been able to find street parking within a block. Looking forward to coming back again, possibly for a BYOB dinner!
Food was great (came for dinner), new atmosphere was refreshing, and absolutely adore that it's BYOB!

A glorious gem in Ukranian Village, this place never disappoints, which is no small feat considering I come here almost every other weekend for brunch! The brunch menu boasts classic dishes, quasi-epicurean options crafted by talented chefs, lighter fare, homemade milkshakes, and a healthy selection of unique daily specials (that if spectacularly tasty, will eventually run out if you don't get there before around 2pm). The dinner menu is just as fantastic, and similarly features specials for each night of the week. I never order dessert but I did not regret it when I got the fried challah bread pudding with pecans, honey, and whipped cream a few weeks ago.   The staff are friendly and never miss a beat, my coffee is refilled at least three times without me noticing and the food comes out as soon as it's ready. The wait staff are always quick to detail their favorites on the menu when asked, making guests feel at home. The space is clean, pleasingly color coordinated, and lightly decorated, so as to feature the local artists' work that can be found on the walls and purchased if desired. Bite is BYOB and attached to the Empty Bottle, where you can purchase alcohol to drink without a corkage fee. The food is amazingly priced for what it its worth--I have yet to find another place that offers me the same quality for the outpourings of my wallet (all brunch entrees are under $15). Plus, I love the fact that I can wake up and walk over to Bite with a few friends, a bottle of champagne under my arm--without a reservation--and  eat like a Queen. I have brought countless family members here and literally every single out-of-town guest I have ever had. I even saw my boss here!? My absolute favorite brunch dishes are the Breakfast Poutine with bacon gravy (you can choose a vegetarian option of mushroom gravy), Pimento Cheese Eggs Benedict, and the Pork Hash. Luckily, everything you order here will make you want to hug your waitress and come back.  Be forewarned: if you go during "busy brunch" hours, there will more often than not be a small wait (definitely worth it) but that's only because this place is so coveted by locals and stragglers from other neighborhoods who've heard what all the fuss is about.

Definitely a decent spot to have some brunch.  A friend and I came here and the menu was large, vegetarian-friendly and included a lot of different combinations of flavors.  Though I'm not a vegetarian, I really enjoy a lot of meatless meals, especially when they involve plays on various Benedicts.   The breakfast tacos were delish and available in various styles.  Since they're priced individually, you can order as many or as few as you'd like.  I enjoyed a veggie Benedict - the eggs were cooked well, the sauce was yummy and the presentation was nice. Only two downsides to this place: It's small, so there's usually a wait if you arrive after 10 a.m.  Also, since it's so small, if you sit near the door and it is at all chilly (or God forbid, cold) you will be blown with cold air almost constantly since no one respects the "shut the outer door before opening the inner door" rule. There's no breakfast cocktails.   Lame.

People are likely to miss this tiny cafe which happens to be directly adjacent to one of the best bars in Ukranian Village, but don't let the size of the place fool you. For a small cafe, it has a lot of charm, a surprisingly big and diverse menu and it's a great place to go without any of the noise and craziness of other breakfast places. If you're a fan of corn beef hash for breakfast/brunch, next time try something different. The PORK HASH at Bite is some of the best braised pork shoulder I've ever had in the city. Be sure to also try the beignets (if they're serving that day) on your way out which are a nice touch. I don't know too many places in Chicago that serve these miniature bites of awesomeness.

The food here is decent and priced decently, but I'm not planning to go back due to the service. I've been twice, and both times the hosts and servers were unwelcoming and aloof. They give the impression that they're doing you a favor by taking your name for the wait list, sitting you, and serving you. The server also didn't check back often on my second visit, leaving lots of empty water glasses at our table. I'm no longer willing to pay to be begrudgingly tolerated at their restaurant.

The Bite Cafe is a tiny spot just south of Division on Western Ave. It's connected to a large game room and a bar. There was no wait this morning so I did not get a chance to use either of those rooms, though I will say the wall of baby heads is quite creepy. Thankfully that's not in the restaurant. Went for brunch this morning and wound up sharing a starter of the White Chocolate Pecan Bread along with the Pork Hash (which was recommended many times here on Yelp). Of the two, the Pecan Bread was the star. Warm, cakey, with a ton of flavor - I could have just ordered a few of these and been content. It's not like the Pork Hash was bad - it was tasty but it had a ton of Hollandaise Sauce (I'd ask for light next time) and the potatoes were solid but nothing spectacular. But the pork was very tasty, the potatoes did soak up the poached eggs, and kale was a nice alternative to spinach. I would probably try a different item next time as the menu is quite diverse with a ton of good looking options.

I like the casual but classy atmosphere here a lot. Service was excellent. Food was delicious and eclectic - I especially appreciated BYOB with no corkage fee and the seafood options. Dessert waffle was a bit crispy and oily but I liked it that way with some acidity in the sauce and creamy ice cream on top. Lovely place for dinner for two.

This place has a hipster vibe, and food is delicious. The price is very reasonable but you get meal that would be served at a fancy restaurant. The only downside is that this place does not serve alcohol. The attached bar serves drinks but it's more of a dive bar and drinks were not that good. So if you are heading out to Cafe Bite make sure to bring your own alcoholic beverage.

more like 3.5... the food was good. actually, it was REALLY good. ultimately, that's what's most important. it's also BYOB with NO corkage fee, which is always a plus in my book. i had the grilled cheese with bacon and the tomato soup with fennel which was GREAT, and that's saying a lot for a grilled cheese, lol. a friend at the table had the burger that she requested to be cooked medium but it came out VERY well done. despite that, it was still very good. the breakfast tacos, the challah bread french toast and the migas were also all very good. they made a few changes to one of the dishes for a vegetarian at the table with no problems at all. no complaints regarding the food at the table.  the deduction of the 1.5 star is because it's so small (not really their fault...but not mine either) and for all the people who were trying to come in although there was no room, yet continued to stand there with the doors open when it was a brisk 30 degrees outside. the staff was a bit testy in asking them to shut it - which i totally understand. it was FREEZING in there...and i'm the guy that runs the AC at home in the winter.  to their credit, they did everything they could to accommodate our large party of ten - literally almost half the restaurant, and kept our wine and bubbly cold while we waited...but once we got the bill, the service stopped there and we were told (kind of rudely actually) that there was a long wait and we needed to go next door. no problem, but can we have our credit card, the to-go boxes we requested and our remaining bottles of Prosecco first? it's not WHAT you say but HOW. it's all in the delivery...and i feel like there was a better way. the experience wasn't bad enough to keep me from returning though.

Cool joint to hang and get some really good, affordable grub at practically anytime.  Had the burger (threw on an egg) as well as one of the special squash salads... A perfect Saturday afternoon meal.  What a great option of catching a show at Empty Bottle next door (connected). Cool casual vibe...

Burger seemed salty but well intentioned. Made me salty. Listened to a live episode of This American Life on my flight home and when Ira mentioned The Empty Bottle the crowd went wild. Waitress at Bite told us The Empty Bottle was closed when we tried to get in. I am now a salt lick. Great service regardless.

Based on my dinner experience here, this is a decent place. Now, I did see awesome tempting food photos on their Yelp page, but most of them were breakfast items. Very curious to try them. For a Tuesday night, the place was packed and they asked us to wait at a cool arcade gaming room next door. Played some oldschool pinball and street fighter while waiting. Tuesday night, is their "steak night". My friend Felt lucky to be able to order their last steak for the night, and see them crossing of their specials board after. LOL I ordered their Burger w melted cheddar cheese and fries (medium well), and I liked it. Fries were great too. Another friend with us ordered tofu tacos and did not like it. She said they were missing any flavor and were bland.  Overall, I liked the place and really want to go back there to try out their breakfast menu.

I love everything about this place...the small cozy atmosphere inside, the super friendly staff, great art on the walls, the great selection/variety of food on their menu, great cuppa coffee, their fantastic biscuit is a must try....and my classic breakfast of eggs bacon and potatoes was hearty and delish!       Unfortunately they were out of "mashbrowns" so the substituted potatoes (which were delicious) but I'm curious to know what the mash was all about. Next time I visit family in Chicago I'll be sure to stop by again as there were many things I would like to try on their menu. Bite is a great place to stop by for a flavorful brunch in a hip little area of town.

Bite Café has changed their menu a bit over the course of the past few yeas...for awhile it was heavily vegetarian and then it swung the other way and I didn't eat there for over 3 years or so.  Now, there are more vegan/vegetarian options but I still wish there were even more.  It's a nice space, though, with well prepared tasty food and good music.

After more than a dozen more meals at Bite over the last couple of years, I've changed my tune. I think this place has really hit its stride and very rarely disappoints. A great neighborhood spot with great food and laid back, friendly staff.

Pimento cheese eggs benedict was so delicious! (Didn't taste cheesy...) It had a pickled tomato with it that really made the dish. The potato mash up was also tasty. The bacon poutine was good, but I guess I'm a traditionalist with the Canadian dish. Coffee was strong.  Love the natural lighting and exposed bricks and slightly gritty vibe...reminds me of Europe. The place was half full/empty around 8 a.m. on Sunday. Many tattoos but definitely a mix of (white) people. One of my new favorite places!

Delicious, filling food, no frills and a Bloody Mary that wasn't terrible.  Could have been excellent with some celery and olives.  I agree with some of the others that say the waitstaff is a little bit on the chilly side, but that didn't really bother me.

There's barely service here, our waiter/hostess had no emotions. The food was good, I recommend the hangover salad but it's not very filling so you may want to get a side. We also got the beets salad, which was okay but was definitely not filling. Overall, a cute small restaurant.

One of the best brunch places in the city. The food is delicious, rich, and affordable. The Breakfast Poutine and pork hash are to die for. I've never had to wait to too long for a table or space at the counter, and any wait is considerably less than you'll find at other brunch places on Milwaukee or Division. To the people complaining about there not being a proper waiting area- you do know that the Empty Bottle is next door right? And they are open during the day? Stop in for a drink or beer during your wait. Service generally is pretty good, I don't have any major complaints. Yes, they may not be as cheerful or smile as often as the nice servers at Yolk, but this is a restaurant attached to the Empty Bottle for Christ sakes- its gonna be a little punk rock.

I've been Bitten (read as smitten) by Bite Cafe.   How anyone gives less than 4 stars is beyond belief.  Service is always on point and prompt. Ask them what they like and you'll know what is the best. The menu constantly changes. The chalkboard rarely repeats. The food is always fantastic and if it's just great, let them know it. The kitchen is so invested in making sure you enjoy your meal which is the point of a restaurant.  BYOB. Oh, you didn't know that? That's chill; go to one of the friendly bartenders at the Bottle and order beer or a btl of wine.  Todd does wear a lot of camo tho... Simply put, the best is Bite.

My boyfriend and I come here often! This past particular weekend, Saturday, we came in for Brunch. From our experience this place is always packed in the morning, afternoon. We waited at least 20 minutes to be seated, it's never a problem because we know that it's always worth the wait! The bar next door is a bonus while you're waiting, this weekend I was able to relive my childhood and played Street Fighter the arcade to pass the time and it was great! The atmosphere is really nice and welcoming! It is a little cramped but it's never really an issue if you enjoy a nicely packed crowd of people from all walks of life! I will say that it can get a little loud, I find that characteristic to be apart of the experience and don't mind it at all! The staff is great, they are always very welcoming! This recent visit our waitress was very open to making suggestions, quick little chats like that definitely warm up the experience. The staff is very attentive, our glasses were always kept full. The staff definitely help to maintain the positive atmosphere and it's not going unnoticed by me and my boyfriend. it really makes a difference! For starters, my boyfriend and I split the Tomato Soup! I have to say that it was pretty amazing, I kind of wish we ordered the meal that would have had the added bonus of the Grilled Cheese! That would have hit the spot! I should mention that the portion size of the soup was more than enough for the two of us to share!  I should mention that I am a Vegetarian and that I am very pleased with the menu! I've been fortunate enough to develop my taste for their menu and have my favorites. This particular Brunch I had the Veggie Burger with a Sunny Side Up Egg and Fries! As usual I was very pleased! I was a mess, my fingers and face were covered with sauce, that's when you know it's good! The portions are pretty big, I always leave stuffed! I was only able to eat half of my Veggie Burger and Fries and best believe I ate the other half an hour or two later!  My boyfriend is a meat eater, he usually orders the breakfast dishes but this particular weekend he ordered the Burger and Fries. He definitely enjoyed it, the minute he picked up his burger it never went back on the plate! He ordered his burger Medium Well and expressed that the cook got it spot on! Bite's Burgers definitely fill you up, my boyfriend was stuffed after finishing his and he barely dented his French Fries, Bonus for me! I am always recommending Bite Cafe to my Family & Friends.  Obviously, I will be back! I have yet to experience the dinner hour!

Pros Fantastic waitress! Great burger & fries Very accommodating Neutral French toast, but then again, it was complimentary due to our 20 minute wait Cons Tomato soup was a bit too sour 20 minute wait time for a party of six Overall:  Yes!  I'd definitely recommend this to a friend.

Will never stop recommending this place to my friends. One of the best places for breakfast and brunch not only in the neighborhood but also in a whole city. There is some wait on the weekends but it's worth it.  Ps, get the poutine.

Delicious, adorable breakfast place with a fantastic menu! Not too bad on the wallet either. Coffee was mediocre and they did not have iced coffee as an option when we went in Oct. Very polite, nice service!

Classy, intimate restaurant with great ambiance and delicious food, but the service is the f**king WORST.  I don't know if our waitress was just having a bad night (like really bad ... like go home instead of being at work bad) or what, but the six of us couldn't believe how poorly we were treated.  From her "announcing" our table being ready by opening the door (we were waiting outside due to limited space within) and looking at us then letting the door close before we could grab it (we were literally two steps away and acknowledged her presence promptly), to her spilling a considerable amount of water onto one of our laps and responding by saying "oh, it's just water" rather than apologizing and offering a towel.  It was pretty absurd.  We took it with a grain of salt and a large helping of wine (thank you BYOB).  And next time I will likely take my business elsewhere.

I was at the Bottle last night, and Lockdown had an hour wait, so I decided to swing by here. It was really, really good and I'm probably just going to head here instead next time.   The restaurant is small and intimate. Candles, BYOB, attentive staff and great food. I had a bite of the beet salad and the pork collar - and both were great. The highlight of my meal was the poutine. It's a must! One of the best I've had in the city. I had a tomato biscuit, and the biscuit was moist and buttery, though the side salad was a little boring. It's kind of awkward that the bathroom is in the kitchen, but whatever, it's a small space.

I have gone back a few times now and have had both great food and service. No, this is not one of those the owner contacted me and gave me free stuff now let me update. I just truly like the place but wanted to get a point about their shaky service across. The food is still great but I do wish they had as many vegetarian options as they have in the past.
The breakfast tacos are soooo good, as is the mac n cheese. Extra props to server, Elisse. Super friendly and accommodating!

The food was pretty quick and I would go here again if I was planning to meet friend at empty bottle, which is also attached to it. Seeing the menu from outside I was skeptical of prices and variety of good but I was pleased with my meal and would return.

The food was prepared perfectly, our waitress was knowledgable about the menu, and everything was more delicious than it looks in the pictures.  Definitely get the beef short ribs if you like meat.  I would eat here again and recommend to friends.

This is a pretty good place to go to before seeing a show at the Empty Bottle, but it will get busy. It's also BYOB, which means you can pregame before a show here as well, if you're so inclined. Nothing on the menu is really to my liking, but I've had the grilled cheese and tomato soup a few times and it has been good enough. The service has been alright every time I've gone.  I went here before a concert the other day and I'm pretty sure the tomato soup made me ill.  That won't stop me from going here again, because it's pretty convenient.
I eat at Bite Cafe about once a week and for good reason. I have never had anything here that wasn't amazing. It's also a huge plus that they serve Dark Matter Coffee!

Great! Attached to the Empty Bottle, so it's okay if you wander in, still clutching your can of Pabst. We had a couple appetizers - the charcuterie plate and the poutine. Everything was very tasty and spot on. There's a bar to sit at and eat, which I always prefer over a table. Will definitely come back to this unpretentious little boite.

I've been wanting to try the food here for quite some time. I met my friend for brunch to celebrate her birthday. I see the other reviews raving about the food, but noting that sometimes the staff is not very friendly. The girl who greeted me when I walked in was kind of rude and blunt, but our server Christine was lovely. She made great recommendations on the food and it was hard to make a decision because everything truly sounded delicious.  I went with her suggestion on the Pork Hash, which was made with juicy and tender Braised Pork Shoulder, Yukon Potatoes, Onions, Tuscan Kale, Cherry Tomato, Corn, Eggs, and Spicy Hollandaise. AMAZING. It was a plentiful portion, and I even took some home to enjoy later. The specials they have listed on the chalkboard all sounded pretty fun and delicious. I tried the Orange/Coconut Bread for a sweet treat, and it did not disappoint!  My friend ordered the House Cured Crispy Pork Belly with Egg and Cheese, Sriracha Aioli and Cheddar Cheese served on an English Muffin. she loved that as well!  It's a cute little spot on the inside. They have beautiful artwork hanging all over the walls. Props to the artists! Christine was super quick with the refills on coffee and beverages and just a friendly gal in general. I'll definitely be back to try more delicious dishes.

This place is good.  I tried the pork hash, carb overload! Eggs, pork, potates, and a piece of toast on the bottom!  The place is very small and does not have much seating so come early before the rush.  The coffee is really strong.

One of the best veggie burgers I've ever had, and it's BYOB. I would definitely come back here. Service was fantastic, and we were never rushed through our meal at all. I can't wait to come back and try the brunch!
Yum - the eggs are done right here and its a BYOB. Only one issue - this isn't the nicest part of town, and you definitely tell. Come here late night for a burger!

great place to get a great lunch. menu changes from time to time and some of the vegan options kind of turn me off to some of the items on the menu as they would be great if they didnt have that stuff in it. oh well, i guess it appeals to the local neighborhood. great place for lunch!

This is our first visit and we really enjoyed our brunch.The pork and collard green omelette was original and delicious! Our waitress mistakenly ordered an additional and returned it without any issues. Customer service was awesome! We will return with friends.

Great place for brunch!  Small place, so expect to wait 20-30 minutes.  BYOB, but connected to the empty bottle if you want to pop over before or after for a drink. Pork hash was fantastic. Breakfast poutine was also delicious. Dark Matter coffee is the house coffee. Would definitely recommend for brunch, and we'll be coming back to try dinner.

Bite is such a great brunch spot! Be sure to get here early on the weekends because this little place sure does get busy. Luckily you can grab a cocktail while you wait in the bar next door. I love to grab a seat by the window! We start off with some coffee and a biscuit with jam. I love places that make their own biscuits and jam as a starter because it makes you feel right at home. Some suggestions for dishes would be the eggs Benedict and really any hash they have, but I'd go with the pork hash if they have it. They are also open for dinner and I've gotten a decent burger from there. However, breakfast is definitely the forte here!
My favorite breakfast. I've been eating here about once a week (at a minimum) for over three years. Just love it.

We decided to try Bite based on the Yelp reviews and were not disappointed. We went for Sunday brunch and ended up sitting at the bar next door, so we didn't have to wait. The service was good and so was the atmosphere. It took a while to get our food and when it came, was a little on the lukewarm side of things. I'm not sure if this was a result of where we were sitting or what, but it's worth mentioning. My Bi Bim Bop was super flavorful and light, exactly what what I was looking for. My husband's breakfast poutine was also very tasty, but he was a bit disappointed that his poached egg arrived hard boiled. I'm excited to try Bite again and I'd love to see what they have in store on the dinner menu!

The service blows. I was waiting for 10 minutes for a menu. Then I waited for over an hour and still had no food. A staff told me they lost my order due to kitchen fire something and they are making my food. 15 minutes later I still had no food. The server didn't offer any toast or anything to hold me over. Nothing! I left starving.
Had the eggs Benedict and it was exceptional. The place was packed with hipsters to the brim. Quite interesting.

Well worth the price for a nice brunch. The place is small, so try and go off peak.  We had the grilled cheese/tomato soup combo and the house Ruben w/fries.  Both sandwiches had very crispy bread and held the ingredients nicely.
